comments:
eclipse -confgiruation file:foo does not resolve correctly in the startup 
code.  Ideally we should resove the relative URL to an absolute one and set 
osgi.configuration.area to that value.  Leaving relative seems to cause 
interpretation problems.

Pascal, isn't this code in the eclipse startup, not in update?
Update configurator expects a directory via 
IPlatform.getConfigurationMetadataLocation().
I mentioned this problem to Jeff.

This is definitely in startup.jar.  We need to decide what it would mean to 
allow relative urls.  What is it relativel to?  The install location (e.g., 
wherever startup.jar is?  The current working dir?)

Dorian, you had a usecase where this was interesting.  Can you tell us more?

The parameter specification should be similar to what we do for -data.
If I launch eclipse from a command prompt, I usually cd to eclipse directory, 
then launch eclipse. When I experiment with with various things, I usually 
change the -data and the -configuration to other subdirectories under eclipse.
For -data, I always pass a relative (to eclipse) directory.
For -configuration, I wanted to pass a directory name but the code expects a 
URL with a protocol (protocol:etc...).
I then use the file: protocol, still keeping the relative path. 
What happens is that the configuration is created (all the files exist), but 
then eclipse does not start and get this error:

!SESSION Dec 12, 2003 14:28:09.507 --------------------------------------------

This bug has been fixed. It is now supported to give a relative file url to 
the -configuration parameter.
Closing.
